definitions.definition: To be in opposition; to contest ; to dispute ; to vie ; to quarrel ; to fight .
To struggle or exert oneself to obtain or retain possession of, or to defend.
To be in debate ; to engage in discussion ; to dispute ; to argue .
To believe (something is reasonable) and argue (for it); to advocate .
examples: In this paper the author contends that no useful results can be obtained if this method is used.

definitions.definition: contend with : To try to cope with a difficulty or problem.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To be in opposition; to contest ; to dispute ; to vie ; to quarrel ; to fight .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To struggle or exert oneself to obtain or retain possession of, or to defend.
( intransitive ) To be in debate ; to engage in discussion ; to dispute ; to argue .
( intransitive ) To believe (something is reasonable) and argue (for it); to advocate .
contend with : To try to cope with a difficulty or problem.
